法規內容.條文內容: These Regulations were determined pursuant to Article 22 of the Environmental Agents Control Act.
When pest control operators perform operations pest control professional technical personnel shall be at the site to supervise application personnel.

Pest control operators shall train all application personnel employed by them before they start to perform operations. After starting operations they shall be retrained every three years. Personnel that have not undergone retraining may not be ordered to perform operations. But professional technical personnel who have already obtained a qualification certificate as pest control operator need not undergo training when serving as application personnel.
Application personnel who fail to attend one quarter of the total training time during the training period of the foregoing paragraph or fail to pass the practical course shall undergo another training.

Pest control operators that hold trainings of the foregoing article shall first submit an application personnel training plan (for content and format see Attachment 1), together with the pest control operator license application procedure to the special municipality, county or city competent authority for approval.
Application personnel training shall be conducted according to the license content and training records shall be kept and preserved for three years (for records format see Attachment 2). The records shall be reported to the special municipality, county or city competent authority within one month after completion of each training.

Pest control professional technical personnel and application personnel employed by pest control operators shall undergo a medical examination within three weeks after recruitment. Subsequently they shall take a medical examination once per year.
The medical examinations of the foregoing paragraph shall include tests for the choline esterase content of blood. Records of the medical examinations shall be kept and preserved for 10 years for future reference.
When performing operations pest control operators may not use inferior quality environmental agents that have exceeded the validity period.

Pest control operators shall provide the following application instruments and safety equipment on the business premises:
I.      Machinery and dilution instruments (including dilution drums, measuring cylinders, mixers etc.. )
II.     Work clothes, work cap, work shoes, gas mask, safety glasses, protective gloves and other appropriate safety equipment. Safety equipment for individual use shall in principle be used exclusively by each individual.
When diluting or using particular environmental agents in pest control operations on-site personnel and application personnel shall wear protective safety equipment.

Before performing operations pest control operators shall send an application plan to the customer and fully inform the customer on matters regarding the application plan. After the customer has approved and signed the plan, applications may be performed according to the plan contents. Operators may not forcefully perform applications or perform them under the false pretense of acting in the name of the government. The application plan of the foregoing paragraph shall record the following items (Table 1):
I.      Name of pest control operator
II.     Name of customer
III.    Description of location and scope of application
IV.     Pest control target (pest)
V.      Names of pest control professional technical personnel and application personnel
VI.     Names, concentrations and usage quantities of applied agents
VII.    Application time
VIII.   Application methods
IX.     Poisioning prevention and detoxification methods
X.      Matters requiring attention during and after application

Pest control operators shall month by month compile application records (Table 2), and report the application records of the previous year to the special municipality, county or city competent authority before January 31 every year.
The reporting of the foregoing paragraph shall be made via telecommunications online transmissionBut those for whom the competent authority has consented to written reporting shall not be subject to this restriction.

The application plans and application records of the two foregoing articles shall be preserved for three years for future reference after pest control professional technical personnel has confirmed that their content is free of errors and has signed or put their seal on them.

When pest control operators perform applications, application personnel shall wear easily recognizable clothing or shoulder patches identifying their company; The diameter or length and width of their shoulder patches may not be less than 10 centimeters. Shoulder patches or clothing should bear the name of the company, the operator's employee number and a telephone number for customer complaints.
At the site of the applications of the foregoing paragraph clearly visible notification signs and appropriate yellow warning tape shall be installed. The notification sign may not be smaller than A4 size (29.7 cm long, 21 cm wide), and shall contain the name of the pest control operator, the license number, the date and time of applications, control target (pest), application scope, matters requiring attention during and after applications, professional technical personnel, contact person and telephone number.
Pest control operator vehicles that perform operations shall be marked in a prominent place with the name of the company, contact telephone number and (the operator's) license number.
When operations by pest control operators pollute the environment, endanger the ecology or human health, the statutory responsible person, application personnel or pest control professional technical personnel shall immediately halt the applications and adopt control measures, and shall within two hours notify the local special municipality, county or city competent authority.

Pest control operators that obtained their licenses before these Regulations were amended on July 24, 2008, shall report the application personnel training plan determined in Article 4 to the special municipality, county or city competent authority for approval before June 30, 2009, and shall complete application personnel training and submit the training records for future reference.
These Regulations shall take effect on the date of promulgation.
